# Description

As a researcher that mainly uses the experience sampling methodology (ESM) to study social processes and mental health in youth, I aim to make my work as open as possible. During my PhD and postdoc at KU Leuven, I have been involved in finding ways to optimally implement Open Science practices when working with complex (pre-existing) data sets. Practically, I pre- (or post-)register my studies, preprint them, and make my code and materials available.

# Expertise

```{r radarPlot, eval = TRUE}

member_name <- "Robin Achterhof"
special_skill <- c("experience sampling", "driving")

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c("reproducible analysis", "open source software", "data sharing", "data management", all_of(special_skill), "open access", "preregistration"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)

```
